Package com.bhoffpauir.blisp.lib

Class ListAtom

java.lang.Object
com.bhoffpauir.blisp.lib.Atom<List<Object>>
com.bhoffpauir.blisp.lib.ListAtom
public class ListAtom extends Atom<List<Object>>
Atom representation of a list in blisp.

In blisp, lists are represented by atoms that store a List of Object values. These lists can contain various types of elements, including other atoms such as numbers, strings, symbols, or nested lists.

List atoms provide equality checking, where an empty list is considered equal to the SymbolAtom.nil symbol atom. Additionally, this class overrides the toString method to print list elements in a Lisp-style format, with optional extended printing for debug purposes.

The getRegexPattern() method is not applicable for lists and will throw an UnsupportedOperationException if called.

See Also:

  • Method Details

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object atom)
      Tests for equality between this list atom and another object.

      This method supports two types of comparisons:

      • List equality: Two ListAtom objects are considered equal if their lists contain the same elements in the same order.
      • Nil equality: An empty list is considered equal to the SymbolAtom.nil symbol.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      atom - The object to compare with this list atom. It must be either a ListAtom or a SymbolAtom.
      Returns:
      true if the lists or empty list/nil symbol are considered equal, otherwise false.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided object is not a ListAtom or SymbolAtom.

    • getRegexPattern

      public Pattern getRegexPattern()
      Returns a regular expression pattern for matching list atoms.

      This method is not applicable to lists and will throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

      Specified by:
      getRegexPattern in class Atom<List<Object>>
      Returns:
      This method does not return anything as it throws an exception.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if this method is called.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the string representation of the list in a Lisp-style format.

      Each element of the list is converted to a string, and the elements are enclosed in parentheses, separated by commas. If extendedPrint is enabled, the string will be prefixed with "List: " for debugging purposes.

      Specified by:
      toString in class Atom<List<Object>>
      Returns:
      A string representing the list contents.
